game

Class Zombie

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor
      • game.ZombieActor
        • game.Zombie
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Capable, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Printable, edu.monash.fit2099.interfaces.ActorInterface

    public class Zombie
extends ZombieActor
    A Zombie. This Zombie is pretty boring. It needs to be made more interesting. Class representing Zombie as a type of Enemy that attacks the Human and player
    Author:
    weijianlai

    • Method Detail

      • getIntrinsicWeapon

        public edu.monash.fit2099.engine.IntrinsicWeapon getIntrinsicWeapon()
        Description copied from class: edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor
        Creates and returns an intrinsic weapon. By default, the Actor 'punches' for 5 damage. Override this method to create an Actor with more interesting descriptions and/or different damage.
        Overrides:
        getIntrinsicWeapon in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor
        Returns:
        a freshly-instantiated IntrinsicWeapon

      • heal

        public void heal(int points)
        Description copied from class: edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor
        Add points to the current Actor's hitpoint total. This cannot take the hitpoints over the Actor's maximum. If there is an overflow, hitpoints are silently capped at the maximum. Does not check for consciousness: unconscious Actors can still be healed if the game client allows.
        Overrides:
        heal in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor
        Parameters:
        points - number of hitpoints to add.

      • addConvo

        private void addConvo()

      • playTurn

        public edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Action playTurn(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actions actions,
                                                 edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Action lastAction,
                                                 edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameMap map,
                                                 edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Display display)
        Returns an Action to be performed during its turn. It has 10% chance of shouting an insult and it will check if there's any weapon that the Zombie can pick up at its location. If a Zombie can attack, it will. If not, it will chase any human within 10 spaces. If no humans are close enough it will wander randomly. It also checks the zombie's legs in this play turn so that if zombie loses one of its legs or both, the wander behaviour will be affected and cause it to only perform checkweapon and attack behaviour.
        Specified by:
        playTurn in class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Actor
        Parameters:
        actions - list of possible Actions
        lastAction - previous Action, if it was a multiturn action
        map - the map where the current Zombie is
        display - the Display where the Zombie's utterances will be displayed
        Returns:
        the Action to be performed

      • isZombie

        public boolean isZombie()
        return the instance of zombie. It will return true if its a zombie. This is to allow to check from other classes to see if the actor is a zombie
